author: parithosh
content:
I just started looking into the model based testing PR(https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3831) and had some questions/suggestions. 

I wanted to create a thread to discuss the open points before we start using it. 

Option 1:
- We create a new `consensus-model-tests` repo and generate the tests there
- The `generate_vectors` workflow in `consensus-specs` then calls the model test generator and uploads it as an artifact

Option 2:
- We include the model based stuff in `consensus-spec-tests` repo that currently contains the other test generation logic
- The `generate_vectors` workflow in `consensus-specs` then calls the model test generator and uploads it as an artifact

Open questions:
- Which approach do we want to go with?
- Where are these generated tests consumed? Would the clients consume them? Would we add a new CI job (and new test runner) to consume them?
- What sort of infra/resources are needed to run these generators?
- I'm not able to find concrete commands to generate the tests, could someone point me in the right direction? Perhaps with some examples of what needs to go into the CI?
